poem:
Title: "Spectacle of Allegiances"

Men of drama and jest,
Cloaked in borrowed glory,
Vault to the stage of state;
Decked, now, with politics' regalia.
Thatcher - absent, yet a phantom juggernaut,
Casting a muted elegance on our nation's craft.
A play, we are, emptied of meaning, 
Filled with but pomp and feigned allegiance,
The spectacle, our Parliament become.
